thread.title: Girls soccer: Montclair wins SEC-American Division title
thread.title_full: Girls soccer: Montclair wins SEC-American Division title

title: Girls soccer: Montclair wins SEC-American Division title
text:
Girls soccer: Montclair wins SEC-American Division title October 22, 2015 Last updated: Thursday, October 22, 2015, 12:32 AM The Montclair Times Print 
Rebecca Van Siclen and Jillian Jennings each notched a goal and an assist to help the Montclair High School girls soccer team dispatch Nutley, 3-1, in Super Essex Conference-American Division play last Wednesday in Nutley. 
Amalya Johnson added the third goal in Wednesday’s win, while Ming Palling-Goetz made 3 saves to help the Mounties (10-2-1, 9-1-1 SEC-American) end a rare three-game win streak. 
On Monday afternoon, Nutley gave Montclair a boost when it knocked off Glen Ridge, a result that clinched the Mounties’ third consecutive American Division crown. See standings on page C2. 
Montclair hosts Livingston today, Thursday, and will then turn its attention to the Essex County Tournament beginning this weekend. 
The top-seeded and four-time defending champion Mounties will host ninth-seeded Newark Academy at Fortunato Field in quarterfinal action Saturday at 2 p.m. 
Should they advance, MHS would play a county semifinal this Wednesday, Oct. 28, a 7 p.m. kickoff at neutral Millburn High School. The opposition is likely to be either No. 4 Livingston or No. 5 Nutley. 
In between the two ECT clashes, Montclair will also play a competitive independent game on the road at Bridgewater-Raritan this Monday afternoon, Oct. 26.
